1���Sanction�� is a magic spell that we use to observe and assess mercenaries' actions.
1�Defeating enemies while you have Sanction cast on you will raise your Imperial Standing. Also, the stronger the monsters you fight, the higher your Imperial Standing will become.
1�When fighting in a beastman stronghold that has taken the Astral Candescence, your Imperial Standing will rise by a significant amount as thanks for your participation in the recovery effort.
1�Sanction is also necessary in order to receive crystals from the enemies you defeat.
1�But you must take caution. Stepping too far out of the Empire's boundaries will cause Sanction to wear off.
1�You can raise your Imperial Standing by defeating enemies while you have Sanction cast on you.
1�Saving a captured prisoner in a beastman stronghold and submitting archaic mirrors to Imperial guards will also result in an increased Imperial Standing.
1�You can view your Imperial Standing by selecting ��Besieged�� under ��Region Info.��
1�You can also speak to me at any time to exchange your Imperial Standing credits for items.
1�What about Besieged?Never mind.Besieged basics.��Serpent Generals.��Astral Candescence in Al Zahbi.Astral Candescence with beastmen.Empire's current state of defense.
1���Besieged�� occurs when the beastman armies breach the walls of Al Zahbi.
1�Everyone in town who is capable of wielding a weapon is called to action to defend Al Zahbi alongside the Imperial Army.
1�The beastmen's main purpose is to enter the Hall of Binding and wrest the ��Astral Candescence�� from the Empire's control.
1�You need not know what the Astral Candescence is.
1�All you must know is that it is your duty to protect the five Serpent Generals who hold the keys to the Hall of Binding, and to drive the beastman hordes from the Imperial capital.
1�The Empire's safety and its future rest on your capable shoulders!Rest assured that you will be rewarded for your efforts.
1�The Empire's defense is entrusted to five generals.
1�Each possesses a name corresponding to the symbols of the Empire--the serpents of flame, water, stone, gales, and sky.
1�Furthermore, the mirrors used to open the Hall of Binding are divided among their possession. Thus, the generals' fates determine the tide of battle.
1�If all five generals should fall in battle, the Hall of Binding will open, and the beastmen will be able to seize the Astral Candescence.
1�It is your responsibility to prevent such a disaster from happening. We are depending on you!
1�When the Astral Candescence is safely resting on its plinth in the Hall of Binding, it emanates waves that bestow special bonuses to Sanction.
1�The first bonus is a slight boost to the amount of experience points received from battles. You will receive this effect simply by having Sanction cast on you.
1�There are several other bonus effects, but you must sacrifice some of your Imperial Standing credits in order to receive them.
1�Keep in mind that the bonuses become more powerful with the number of times the Imperial capital is successfully defended.
1�Sanction's strength will reset if the beastmen succeed in invading the Hall of Binding, though.
1�The waves emanating from the Astral Candescence in Al Zahbi bring a multitude of blessings to all of us. You must not let it fall into the hands of the beastmen!

1�If the beastmen manage to take the Astral Candescence, its recovery will become our top priority. Find the coveted item on a plinth in one of the beastman strongholds and seize it back for the Empire!
1�We aren't quite sure what the beastmen are scheming to do with such power, but we do know that the Astral Candescence's waves can increase the beastmen's strength.
1�As if that weren't enough, we have recent reports that the beastmen have set ��archaic mirrors�� in their strongholds to magnify the power of the waves.

1�Venture roll is a competitive game played with dice similar to those used by corsairs. The objective is to roll until your cumulative total comes as close to 11 as possible without going over.

1�Until you reach or go over 11, you may continue rolling (doubling up) as many times as the table time limit allows (
  � [minute/minutes], Earth time).
1�In addition to doubling up, you may also decline to roll the dice and stay with your current total (hold fast).
1�If your total ever goes over 11, you will automatically lose the game, regardless of the totals of other players. Knowing the right time to hold fast is one of the keys to staying in the match.

1�Once all the players have held fast, the game is over and the results are announced. The player closest to 11 is declared the winner and receives all the gil in the pot (the original participation fees of all the players).
